poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: My word - a cad at the dispatch box A junk bond cadged for a cancelled goolie-chit Off a broker canned for indiscretion who When it clanged on him, thought (well he WOULD do) Why me? My word, no sooner calved off of white noise Than it's carved in nice distinctions, One card, in a deck, in a drawer. It gets coined and crammed Under the tongue, clammed up Until, clad in its owner, Who'll have calmed down and out, It means whatever you want.
